Name: Fragments of birds
Description: The tomb of the "embroideress" at Antinoopolis contains many decorated cloths. These two pieces in linen and wool were part of a large collection of fragments of embroidery. They represent  birds, some flying amongst the vegetation, others picking at the grains and raisins. The fragments are distinguished by a beautiful coloring and the refinement in the rendering of volume, obtained by a subtle play of gradation.
